I guess this is (unfortunately) a normal behavior for auto differentiation process: you have a 0 * inf situation when doing backprop. Basically you have dz/dx = dz/dy * dy/dxand in this case dz/dy = 0 cause by clamping and dy/dx = y = exp(big_number_x) = inf

In your case I would recommend do clamping before exp to avoid inf at the first place.

body:
I guess this is (unfortunately) a normal behavior for auto differentiation process: you have a `0 * inf` situation when doing backprop.  Basically you have `dz/dx = dz/dy * dy/dx`and in this case `dz/dy = 0` cause by clamping and `dy/dx = y = exp(big_number_x) = inf`

In your case I would recommend do clamping before `exp` to avoid `inf` at the first place.
